page.title: List of tools to create Live USB systems

rev.diff:
Line 5: Line 5:
*[[Ubuntu Live USB creator]], the tool included in Ubuntu 8.10, installs [[Ubuntu]], runs only on Linux.
*[[Ubuntu Live USB creator]], the tool included in Ubuntu 8.10, installs [[Ubuntu]], runs only on Linux.
*[[cd2usb]], windows tool to create Live USBs of [[Ubuntu]] and [[Super OS]] (already included in [[Super OS]])
*[[cd2usb]], windows tool to create Live USBs of [[Ubuntu]] and [[Super OS]] (already included in [[Super OS]])

*FUSBi, based on UNetbootin, downloads distributions endorsed as 'free' by the [[FSF]].

<!-- It should be mentioned though that there are live systems that are not dependant on [[Linux]]. One example is a Windows Command Line live USB. A tutorial can be found at: http://www.nforcershq.com/forum/3-vt65107.html? -->
